channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Childhood Cancer & Awareness Month
item.description:
Tuesday, September 27, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Gold to support Childhood Cancer & Awareness Month

September is Go Gold for Childhood Cancer Awareness month. Each year in Australia, more than 1,000 children and adolescents are diagnosed with cancer and two-thirds of children who survive suffer serious long-term effects.

This light up is organised by The Golden Octopus Foundation

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: ITP Awareness Week
item.description:
Wednesday, September 28, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support ITP Awareness Week 

The annual ITP Awareness Week campaign raises awareness for those living with the rare disease ITP. As with many rare diseases, many ITP patients never get the chance to meet another patient in person, so by lighting up various structures purple across the country, we provide local patients with the knowledge that they aren’t in this alone.

ITP is a rare autoimmune blood disorder where the body’s immune system attacks platelets. Platelets assist the blood to clot and patients with ITP have a low platelet count. Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms including spontaneous bleeding, bruising, fatigue, anxiety and mood changes.

This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day
item.description:
Wednesday, September 28, 2022

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Blue and White to recognise National Police Remembrance Day 

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: QLD Police Service

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.x-trumba:customfield: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Eve of United Nations Day of the Older Person and Queensland Seniors Month
item.description:
Friday, September 30, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple Pink Gold sparkle to support Eve of United Nations Day of the Older Person and Queensland Seniors Month

Council on the Ageing (COTA) Queensland, a member of the COTA Federation is a for purpose registered charity committed to advancing the rights, needs, interests, and futures of people as we age. Our vision is that ageing in Queensland is a time of possibility, opportunity and influence. The second annual Queensland Seniors Month will begin on the United Nations Day of Older People, highlighting the important contributions that older people make to society and raising awareness of the issues and challenges of ageing in today's world.

This Light Up is organised by: Council Of The Aging Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Probus Day - International Day for Older Persons
item.description:
Saturday, October 1, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit blue to support Probus Day - International Day for Older Persons

Probus South Pacific is a not-for-profit organisation that provides retirees with the opportunity to connect socially with like-minded retirees within their local communities. Probus Clubs offer a range of activities including trips and outings for members to enjoy, depending on their interests, lifestyle and location. Probus Club members meet monthly, to enjoy the company of fellow retirees and listen to interesting guest speakers. October 1st is our annual Probus Day which is also aligned with the United Nations Day of Older People. This day highlights the important contributions that older people make to society and raising awareness of the issues and challenges of ageing in today's world as well as the need for connection and togetherness.

This Light Up is organised by: Probus South Pacific Limited

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.description:
Saturday, October 1, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit blue to support Probus Day - International Day for Older Persons

Probus South Pacific is a not-for-profit organisation that provides retirees with the opportunity to connect socially with like-minded retirees within their local communities. Probus Clubs offer a range of activities including trips and outings for members to enjoy, depending on their interests, lifestyle and location. Probus Club members meet monthly, to enjoy the company of fellow retirees and listen to interesting guest speakers. October 1st is our annual Probus Day which is also aligned with the United Nations Day of Older People. This day highlights the important contributions that older people make to society and raising awareness of the issues and challenges of ageing in today's world as well as the need for connection and togetherness.

This Light Up is organised by: Probus South Pacific Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Breast Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, October 2, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Pink to support Breast Cancer Awareness Month

 The National Breast Cancer Foundation (NBCF) is Australia’s leading national body funding game-changing breast cancer research with money raised entirely by the Australian public. We receive no government funding. What we do, would not be possible without the support and generosity the community. Our mission is simple: stop deaths from breast cancer. How? By identifying, funding and championing world-class research -research that will help us detect tumours earlier, improve treatment outcomes.

This Light Up is organised by: National Breast Cancer Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Mahatma Gandhi's Birth Anniversary
item.description:
Sunday, October 2, 2022

The City Hall will be lit White, orange and green to support Mahatma Gandhi's Birth Anniversary

The 2nd of October is the birth anniversary for Mahatma Gandhi, and as India celebrates 75 years of independence, the important message of Gandhi's non violent means to achieve independence becomes more relevant and important for the entire world.

This Light Up is organised by: Archana Singh

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: #LightItRedforDyslexia Dyslexia Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, October 3, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Red to support #LightItRedforDyslexia Dyslexia Awareness Month

Code Read Dyslexia Network supports people experiencing learning differences such as Dyslexia by providing psychometric assessments, intensive literacy programs and quality evidence-based advice and information. October is International Dyslexia awareness month. We would like to raise the awareness of Dyslexia throughout Brisbane, and support and empower those with dyslexia and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Code Read Dyslexia Network

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Day of Unity and German Week
item.description:
Monday, October 3, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Black, yellow and red to support National Day of Unity and German Week

The German Consulate is the initiator of Brisbane German Week 2022, raising awareness of Queensland’s strong German connections: social (community), cultural (art, music, film), educational (language, business, travel, sport), economic (businesses and chambers), political (German and Qld Government) and scientific/innovation connections (universities, research, hospitals). Brisbane German Week 2022 will be highlighting each of the above mentioned connections, creating a true community atmosphere in a fortnight-long event series starting 1 October. About 20,000 Germans call Queensland Home. The German National Day “Day of German Unity” on 3rd October will be one of the highlights, marking the day when East and West Germany were reunited after the cold war. The year 2022 will mark 32 years of German reunification.

This Light Up is organised by: Honorary Consul of the Republic of Germany

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Amputee Awareness Week
item.description:
Tuesday, October 4, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support National Amputee Awareness Week

Limbs 4 Life is the peak body for amputees in Australia and was founded as a charity in 2004. Limbs 4 Life’s mission is ‘To provide information and support to amputees and their families while promoting an inclusive community’ and vision is that ‘no amputee goes through the process of limbs loss alone’. Our philosophy is to empower amputees with knowledge and support to make a real difference, because ‘no one should have to go through limb loss alone’. 10,000 people become amputees each year. National Amputee Awareness Week is held from 4 - 11 October 2022. This event is a chance to celebrate Australians living with limb loss, raise awareness of this disability, and reduce community stigma. Limbs 4 Life will use this awareness campaign to feature the stories of everyday Australian amputees and illuminated buildings to ‘shine a light' on amputees across the country. It is also a chance to assist the community to become ‘amputee aware’ and reduce the risk of preventable amputations.

This Light Up is organised by: Limbs 4 Life Incorporated

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Brisbane Portrait Prize
item.description:
Wednesday, October 5, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to celebrate Brisbane Portrait Prize

The Brisbane Portrait Prize is all about celebrating Brisbane portrait artists, their sitters and local stories, while encouraging public engagement with the arts. The 2022 Finalists Exhibition, held at the Brisbane Powerhouse, will showcase works from artists of all ages who have been selected as finalists in the Brisbane Portrait Prize. The exhibition runs throughout the month of October with the major prize being the Lord Mayor's Prize of $50,000.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Portrait Prize

item.title: QLD Seniors Month
item.description:
Wednesday, October 5, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Pink, purple and maroon to support QLD Seniors Month

The second annual Queensland Seniors Month will begin on the United Nations Day of Older People, highlighting the important contributions that older people make to society and raising awareness of the issues and challenges of ageing in today's world.  Our vision is that ageing in Queensland is a time of possibility, opportunity and influence.

This Light Up is organised by: Council on the Aging QLD

item.title: Eve of Worldwide Trigeminal Neuralgia International Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 6, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Eve of Worldwide Trigeminal Neuralgia International Awareness Day
 
Trigeminal Neuralgia, TN as its known, is a neurological disease which affects the fifth cranial nerve in the brain and is sometimes described as the most excruciating pain known to humanity. All around the world landmarks will be lit up in teal to raise awareness for this disease.

This Light Up is organised by: TNA Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Headspace Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 6, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Bright Green to support Headspace Day

Headspace day is a national day of support for the mental health and wellbeing of all young Australians, aiming to encourage young people to practice self-care behaviour as well as to empower local communities to have conversations about youth mental health.

This year’s theme is “Pause. Reflect. Reconnect.”

Many young people may be feeling busy, stressed, and anxious about everyday life. This might leave them feeling as though their lives are unbalanced. So, this headspace day, we are encouraging young people to pause, reflect and reconnect with something they love.

This Light Up is organised by: Stride Mental Health

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Once upon a Time in Jaipur Cultural Ball
item.description:
Thursday, October 6, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Maroon, Pink and Purple to support Once upon a Time in Jaipur Cultural Ball

This University Ball will aim provide an opportunity for all four large non-for-profit Indian Cultural university clubs in Brisbane to celebrate Indian culture, strengthen relationships between domestic and international students, and showcase cultural performances and music to the Indian student community and wider public. This will also provide a platform for Indian students to showcase traditional clothing and expression at Brisbane City Hall to inspire our community for years to come. This ball event has been named Once Upon a Time In Jaipur (OUTIJ). This facilities students from South East Queensland from the largest four universities in the region to attend an event which provides an authentic Indian experience in Brisbane City Hall's auditorium.

This Light Up is organised by: University of Queensland Union

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Dyslexia Awareness Month
item.description:
Friday, October 7, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Dyslexia Awareness Month

Code Read Dyslexia Network and Speld Qld supports people experiencing learning differences such as Dyslexia by providing psychometric assessments, intensive literacy programs and quality evidence-based advice and information. October is International Dyslexia awareness month. We would like to raise the awareness of Dyslexia throughout Brisbane, and support and empower those with dyslexia and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Code REaD Dyslexia Network & SPELD Qld

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Recovered Futures Art Exhibition
item.description:
Friday, October 7, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Blue, pink, green, purple, orange, yellow to support the Recovered Futures Art Exhibition
 
Celebrating its 31st  year, the Recovered Futures Art Exhibition raises awareness during Mental Health Week. The event supports approximately 150 artists with a lived experience of mental illness to showcase and sell their artwork. This iconic Brisbane exhibition is held at City Hall from the 8th to the 13th of October with free entry, the exhibition is sure to take guests on a poetic journey of self-discovery.

This Light Up is organised by: Richmond Fellowship Queensland (RFQ)

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 40th Anniversary Gala Dinner Being Held at City Hall
item.description:
Saturday, October 8, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Maroon to support 40th Anniversary Gala Dinner Being Held at City Hall 

Queensland Mental Health Week (QMHW) is an annual awareness week that aims to shine a spotlight on individual and community mental health and wellbeing. Funded by the Queensland Mental Health Commission, QMHW is coordinated by CheckUP and delivered by a strong cross-sector collaboration. Queensland Mental Health Week encourages all of us to think about our mental health and wellbeing, regardless of whether we may have a lived experience of mental illness or not, and encourages help seeking behaviours, when needed. Each year, people across Queensland come together during QMHW through local events, conversations and activities to raise awareness. The initiative encompasses World Mental Health Day each year (10 October) and in 2022 will be held from 8-16 October.

This Light Up is organised by: John Paul College

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Oktoberfest
item.description:
Saturday, October 8, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and White to celebrate Oktoberfest

Oktoberfest Brisbane is Australia’s largest traditional German Folk Festival showcasing the breadth and depth of German culture. The Festival emphasises authenticity and tradition and by doing so delivers experiences not typically available outside of Germany. The Festival has grown in popularity and reputation, being named one of the top 10 Oktoberfest celebrations outside Germany by National Geographic. It takes place as part of the Brisbane German Week celebrations; So, dust off your dirndl, strap into your lederhosen, gather your Freunde und Familie and join us on 7-9 & 14-16 Oktober 2022.

This Light Up is organised by: Oktoberfest Brisbane Pty Ltd

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Mental Health Week
item.description:
Sunday, October 9, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Green to support Queensland Mental Health Week 

Queensland Mental Health Week (QMHW) is an annual awareness week that aims to shine a spotlight on individual and community mental health and wellbeing. Funded by the Queensland Mental Health Commission, QMHW is coordinated by CheckUP and delivered by a strong cross-sector collaboration. Queensland Mental Health Week encourages all of us to think about our mental health and wellbeing, regardless of whether we may have a lived experience of mental illness or not, and encourages help seeking behaviours, when needed. Each year, people across Queensland come together during QMHW through local events, conversations and activities to raise awareness. The initiative encompasses World Mental Health Day each year (10 October) and in 2022 will be held from 8-16 October.

This Light Up is organised by: CheckUP Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.description:
Sunday, October 9, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Rainbow to support Recovered Futures Art Exhibition

Celebrating its 31st  year, the Recovered Futures Art Exhibition raises awareness during Mental Health Week. The event supports approximately 150 artists with a lived experience of mental illness to showcase and sell their artwork. This iconic Brisbane exhibition is held at City Hall from the 8th to the 13th of October with free entry, the exhibition is sure to take guests on a poetic journey of self-discovery.

item.description:
Sunday, October 9, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Rainbow to support Recovered Futures Art Exhibition

Celebrating its 31st  year, the Recovered Futures Art Exhibition raises awareness during Mental Health Week. The event supports approximately 150 artists with a lived experience of mental illness to showcase and sell their artwork. This iconic Brisbane exhibition is held at City Hall from the 8th to the 13th of October with free entry, the exhibition is sure to take guests on a poetic journey of self-discovery.

This Light Up is organised by: Richmond Fellowship Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Queensland Mental Health Week
item.description:
Monday, October 10, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Green to support Queensland Mental Health Week 

Queensland Mental Health Week (QMHW) is an annual awareness week that aims to shine a spotlight on individual and community mental health and wellbeing. Funded by the Queensland Mental Health Commission, QMHW is coordinated by CheckUP and delivered by a strong cross-sector collaboration. Queensland Mental Health Week encourages all of us to think about our mental health and wellbeing, regardless of whether we may have a lived experience of mental illness or not, and encourages help seeking behaviours, when needed. Each year, people across Queensland come together during QMHW through local events, conversations and activities to raise awareness. The initiative encompasses World Mental Health Day each year (10 October) and in 2022 will be held from 8-16 October.

This Light Up is organised by: CheckUP Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Parental Alienation Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, October 12, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Parental Alienation Awareness Day

The annual Parental Alienation Awareness Day falls during Mental Health Awareness Week and aims to raise awareness that parental alienating behaviours are child abuse and family violence.

The Eeny Meeny Miney Mo Foundation aims to reduce the prevalence and impact of parental alienation and its consequences in the Australian community through research, evidence based interventions, therapy and support.

This Light Up is organised by: Eeny Meeny Miney Mo Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Paniyiri
item.description:
Thursday, October 13, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to celebrate Paniyiri

The Paniyiri 2022 Greek Festival - Brisbane’s world renowned cultural festival, where everyone is encouraged to dine, dance, and party like a Greek will be held in Musgrave Park October 15 and 16 Paniyiri is a festival of everything Greek, featuring an exciting cultural celebration of food, dance, music, art, cooking, live entertainment and history. An eagerly anticipated annual event, Paniyiri unites the Greek Community of South East Queensland with the general community in a celebration of fun, food and friendship.

This Light Up is organised by: Greek Orthodox Community of St George

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: International Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, October 14, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Yellow to support International Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day

Raising Awareness of Developmental Language Disorder (RADLD) is a volunteer, international group whose vision is a world where people with DLD are supported to pursue their goals and aspirations. RADLD partners with the community to foster a substantial increase in international awareness of DLD. Despite affecting 7.6% of the population, Developmental Language Disorder (DLD) remains a hidden disability for most people around the world. DLD affects a person’s ability to understand and use their native language for no known reason. This has significant repercussions for a person’s academic outcomes, mental health and employment. You can find out more about DLD at www.radld.org

This Light Up is organised by: Raising Awareness of Development Language Disorder

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

RADLD partners with the community to foster a substantial increase in international awareness of DLD. Despite affecting 7.6% of the population, Developmental Language Disorder (DLD) remains a hidden disability for most people around the world. DLD affects a person’s ability to understand and use their native language for no known reason. This has significant repercussions for a person’s academic outcomes, mental health and employment. You can find out more about DLD at www.radld.org

This Light Up is organised by: Raising Awareness of Developmental Language Disorder

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day
item.description:
Saturday, October 15, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day

International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day raises awareness of pregnancy and infant loss, which  is an issue that touches all Queenslanders either directly or indirectly through a parent or sibling. The lighting of buildings and landmarks across Australia forms part of the International Wave of Light which sees landmarks across the world lit in pink and blue on October 15.

This Light Up is organised by: Pregnancy and Infant Loss Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Anti Poverty Week
item.description:
Sunday, October 16, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support Anti Poverty Week

Save The Children is aligned with other not for profit organisations (such as PeakCare / Mission / ActForKids etc) in advocating that Anti-Poverty Week supports the Australian community to have an increased understanding of poverty and to take action collectively to end it. We are a diverse network of individuals and organisations who share this purpose. Since 2002, we have been active each year in the week around the 17th of October, the United Nations Day for the Eradication of Poverty. Anti-Poverty Week supports the Australian community to have an increased understanding of poverty and to take action collectively to end it.

This Light Up is organised by: Save the Children Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Carers Week
item.description:
Monday, October 17, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support Carers Week

The Carers Foundation Australia supports the nearly 3million unpaid carers in Australia, some as young as 8 years old. Carers Week aims to raise awareness of unpaid carers in our communities.

This Light Up is organised by: The Carers Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
